name: Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya

reviews.title: Thoroughly enjoyed it
reviews.text: Stayed in Gran Torre after reading reviews. We were not disappointed. The staff were so helpful. I learned a lot about Barcelona after reading through forums. It made my trip much more enjoyable and knew where to go and what to see. Don't forget to go to Placa Espana [ just a ten minute walk from hotel] and enjoy the wonderful display of the water fountain with the vibrant colours and wonderful music.

reviews.title: Brilliant hotel and great location
reviews.text: THe hotel is so well situated as it is a short journey on metro to centre and is a pleasure to return to a quiet restful room.

reviews.title: excellent hotel!
reviews.text: Brilliant hotel across the road from the main Sants station and just a couple of stops from the centre. Dont miss breakfast on the 23rd floor restaurant the view is fantastic. When going out to eat go through the station and cross over the road at the front and go a few hundred yards up the straight and you will come to very reasonable Spanish Restaurants which do not rip you off they are not the tourist filled places but full of locals. Use the metro to get in to Sants station from the Airport get a 10 trip ticket if you are staying for a few days and this also covers your trip to and from the Airport. A 10 minute walk takes you to the Barcelona Fountains dont miss this free brilliant fountain show. Nightly during summer and weekends rest of the year.

reviews.title: Not bad hotel
reviews.text: this excellent hotel had everything you could possibly need to enjoy your stay in Barcelona. It is ideally situated directly alongside the railway station, so you have great connections for the metro, the rail network the bus service and the bus touristic. the rooms are clean and fully equipped, the staff are helpful and efficient, and the breakfasts are to die for! eating on the 23rd floor restaurant was the best of starts to the day, and the meal kept us going until suppertime every day!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007
reviews.text: This hotel is conveniently situated within short walking distance of the Barcelona Sants railway station offering direct service from the BCN Airport. The hotel is a modern high-rise, with large contemporary rooms, efficient, helpful staff; and the included breakfast in a beautiful 23rd floor setting was among the best we have experienced in extensive European travels. Highly recommended for reasonable cost lodging in an expensive, beautiful city.
reviews.title: Modern, Well-Run Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Just returned from a 4 night break in Barcelona, staying at Torre Catalunya. Very difficult to fault the hotel at all - every member of staff we came into contact with was polite, helpful and very friendly; the hotel is very modern (without feeling cold) and spotlessly clean; the views from the windows are pretty incredible. Our only complaint would be concerning the restaurant on the 23rd floor - fantastic views over Barcelona (especially at night) but the meal we had there on our first night was very expensive for what it was - and dare I say rather pretentious? The steaks we asked for "well done" were all very underdone and full of gristle - practically inedible! The desserts were OK, but one was served on a badly cracked dish - when we complained, they readily offered not to charge for any of the three desserts. Maybe we were just unfortunate to experience this, but we did not eat in the restaurant again during out stay. However, that said, the Lounge Bar on the ground floor serves a very good choice of meals at lunch and in the evening, and each meal we had there was delicious (and much cheaper!). Breakfasts (on 23rd floor) are great - everything you could possible want, from beautiful fresh fruits to bacon; pastries to cereals.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel!

However, if you don't mind travelling a bit then this is a nice hotel. An added plus is that one of the "tourist tour" buses stops near the hotel (but get to the bus stop early as that gets busy - goodness knows what it's like at peak times in the summer months!)

reviews.title: Gorgeous
reviews.text: Now as if that wasn’t enough we stayed in the most amazing hotel. The rooms were great and very clean with beautiful views over Barcelona, the bathrooms were gorgeous! The staffs were very helpful and friendly and the beauticians are excellent, the gym and the health spa are also very good. I have to say the best thing about this hotel was definitely the beautiful breakfast on the 42 floor (which is the very top), the food is great! And the views over the whole city are spectacular! The breakfast is free for all guests! They also do evening meals up there at night; these aren’t free and are extremely expensive a meal for 2 set us back £90! Although we were glad we tried it as it was a really nice experience.

reviews.title: fantastic, money well spent
reviews.text: if people can complain about this hotel they must be searching for something cause any complaints regarding this hotel have to be minor - what do people want for their money ??? the hotel is situated right next to the main train station making it simple to commute around. the hotel itself boasts great rooms, great bathrooms (huge) and a small but well equipped and very clean spa area. the staff are very friendly and cant seem to do enough. we asked for a room above the 10th floor as suggested by other visitors and got a room on the 18th (what great views) ok so the air con was alittle noisy, ok so there were 2 seperate beds (but there was room for 2 in the bath and the shower) for this money you would get a b+b break in a travel inn in the uk and maybe have a tenner spare in your pocket. dont be a fool and ignore this great hotel. barcelona is a great city there is so much to see and do, i will definatley go back and i wouldnt consider staying anywhere else.

reviews.text: Wonderful Hotel. Staff was excellent, rooms were modern and clean. Engligh well spoken. Restaurant was nice although a little pricy for breakfast but the view was worth it. Also, once we left the phone off the hook and the front desk staff actually came to our room to wake us. Very nice. Highly recommended. Spa was ok.. Our room was located on the 19th floor and boasted breathtaking views across the impressive city. The room was spacious, modern and impeccably clean, and the bed was huge and very comfortable. I have to say, the staff at this hotel are the best I've ever encountered and went out of their way to assisst in any way that they could (one porter actually walked off into the city and came back in a taxi for us to use). Also, the restaurant on the 23rd floor is magnificent, and again, the views are quite simply spectacular.

reviews.title: Outstanding
reviews.text: Initially, I was a bit worried about the hotels location, and wondered whether it would be too far out from the main attractions. I needn't have been concerned. There is a Metro station located about 200 yards from the hotel entrance (Sants Estacio) and it's less than ten minutes to The Ramblas (about 4 or 5 short stops). The underground rail network is astonishingly efficient and so we waited no more than two minutes (literally) for a train to arrive. And, at just over one Euro per trip it is extremely good value for money. However, if you're wary about travelling on the underground (you needn't be) then there are thousands of taxi's around the city and you'll wait no more than a couple of minutes outside the hotel.

reviews.title: Great hotel
Nice Hotel for European Standards, but with Problems
reviews.text: This hotel was very nice. The room we received was very large even for American standards and two walls were windows so we had a great view. The bathroom was sizable as well. There was a bathroom with lots of amenities and separate shower. There were large closets, two tables, two chairs, large TV, and even a radio. The only problem was that when I had switched on a light, the circuit blew and we ended up sitting in the dark, along with our next door neighbors. The hotel staff came in and tried to fix the lights, but they could not. They gave us another room. That room was equally large. However, the bathroom wreaked of sewage. It was disgusting. The room also faced Sants Station, which was another negative. After going through the fiasco of packing up and moving late at night to the 2nd room, we found that the construction was still going on and would keep us up, if the smell of the bathroom did not. We went back down and asked for another room. This time, we got a smaller one, but at least the bathroom did not smell and we weren't facing the construction. However, by the time we went to bed, it was quite late.

reviews.title: Geat Hotel if you get it on a deal price
reviews.text: All in all, even though we had to go through this fiasco of changing rooms, the staff was accommodating.

reviews.title: Great City, Great Hotel!
reviews.text: The location of the hotel was convenient. Sants Station was just around the corner and you could get anywhere form there. The train from the airport went straight here as well. There was a supermarket next door to obtain any necessities or food that was desired. It was convenient overall.

reviews.title: Great staff - good location
reviews.text: We got a good deal on this hotel through laterooms.com. We payed £530.00 and stayed for 5 nights. We paid the extra amount for the room on the higher floor, which was well worth it for the brilliant night views of the city. It was a great hotel in a handy location. It is not in the centre of Barcelona but is right beside both the underground and the train station. The rooms were a lovely size with a nice big bathroom, clean and fully equiped. The staff were lovely and very helpful. There is internet access on the basement floor, free for the first half hour! You could have wi fi access for 24 hours for about €10. This is very handy if, like us , you travel with the lap top. The restaurant on the top floor is worth checking out. Its a bit pricey, but worth splashing out on for one night for the fab. views over the city. The food was good and some nice wines. There is a free bottle of cava with the voucher they give you on check in, but you have to be seated before a certain time. I didn't eat in the hotel for anything else. Breakfast for us was in the cafe which is in the supermarket under the hotel, again very handy. This is a great hotel in a handy location. I highly recommend both the hotel and Barcelona which is an amazing city with so much to see and do. We are planning to return with our toddler son soon and will be checking out the Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya for our next good deal.

SANTS station is undergoing major renovations and it was a bit dusty outside but not really much noise. this hotel is not really in central Barcelona and if you are travelling with a baby, not all metro stations have lifts so alot of stairs to climb!!! Overall a great hotel but a bit way out from the centre and sights. Also no nice restaurants in the local area so you have to go on train for something nice to eat. the lounge bar in the hotel is great and so is the spa. GREAT HOTEL lovely rooms!!! Also a supermarket below so great for stocking UP!!!

reviews.text: We were very lucky - but if you believe that then- we were upgraded to a suite at no extra charge 5 nights. I would stay there again tonight if I could!We were on the 19th floor and with a corner suite overklooking magic fountain to the S West and the sangrda familia to the south(excuse spelling please).
reviews.title: whatever else coulld you want
Awesome hotel!!!
reviews.text: PS if you like a beer the hypermarket next door sells the same brand as the minibar at 50cents a can not 3 euros

reviews.title: Lovely hotel. Convenient location.
reviews.text: I am a 23 year old male and I went to this hotel with my boyfriend who is 25. The hotel is beautiful and very clean. The rooms are really clean and moder and they have the most perfect shower system. (Very nice to wake up to) I have to say the staff are amongst the most helpful I have ever come across. They are willing to go out of their way to help you with anything you need. They are lovely and polite. It is however a little business orientated with it's layout but this definately does not effect your stay. If you are there to see the city then it is great although you will have to get the train into the centre as it is too far to walk so bare that in mind. The train station is literally directly next to the hotel which is just perfect for those hoping to visit Sitges (which you have to see!). Sitges is 20 mins by train costing about 3 uk pounds. It is like the Spanish version of St Tropez I suppose and is full of beautiful people, lovely restaurants and shops and a row of different beaches. I say different because there is some nudest beaches and gay beaches. It caters for all tastes. A great place to visit! The hotel will tell you all you need to know. I would have preferred to stay nearer the centre slightly as there is not much to see around the hotel but the centre is only one stop on the train and is not much of a bother. The only annoying thing was when we wanted to eat locallu there was not much around. The trains there are amazing - they go everywhere in Barcelona. The food in the hotel is a little pricey but no more than any other. The pool and spa treatment is wonderful. They have the internet at a cheap price as well. Overall I highly reccomend this hotel but if you are looking for somewhere very near the city and the clubs then this one may not be for you. You could get a little closer BUT you will not be dissapointed with this hotel I guarantee you.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stay at Gran Torre Catalunya for a week during christmas, it was great, everything we expect and more. Very clean and modern. The bath room was big, with tub, and a toilet a part. The staff was friendly and helpful.We ask for wakeup calls and they call us as asked. We have once dinner at the Visual restaurat in the top, I recomend you eat there once, and make a reservation for a table near a window, so you get the spectacular city view.
reviews.title: Great Stay!!!!! If I go back to Barcelona, will stay here again

likes.liked: — Great location, great view from the top, confortable, clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I really enjoyed our stay in the hotel for four nights at the end of September. We stayed in an executive double room, which whilst not particularly large, was well equipped and kept clean throughout our visit.
reviews.title: Amazing views and lovely rooms- great for couples

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although not especially close to many of the main tourist attractions, a Metro stop opposite the hotel provided quick access to the rest of the city at a reasonable price. Our room was situated on the twelfth floor and afforded beautiful views of the city and surrounding mountains- a bonus over more centrally located accommodation.
reviews.title: Good hotel but noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whilst not detracting from our own experience, the building work outside (including some work at night!) would deter us from recommending this hotel to light sleepers. Also, whilst the hotel caters well for people on business and couples, the lack of hotel based activities may not make it an ideal choice for families with young children. That said, with so much to do in Barcelona itself, this shouldn’t be too much of a deterrent!
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel -You must stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We found the staff to be friendly, polite and hard working. All of the staff we encountered spoke good English, and whilst the hotel did seem fairly quiet at the time of our visit, credit should still be given the very efficient room service.
reviews.title: Fantastic views and a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For couples, we would highly recommend the restaurant at the top of the hotel, which affords panoramic views of the city and serves delicious food. A note of caution, however, as it does come at a cost!
reviews.title: Excellent rooms and great location

likes.disliked: — Sterile atmosphere, clenaing lady not always consistent in her cleaning

However, one will have to take the subway to Placa de Catalunya or a taxi to a nearby transfer point at Francesc Marcia-Diagonal in order to take the Red Line.
reviews.title: Good Hotel but bothered by the worksite

likes.disliked: — The noice from the work site at the front of our room.

reviews.title: Very friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is polite and friendly. The bellboy is particularly helpful. He explained the various switches of the room when he delivered our luggage to us.
reviews.title: Hiccups..but excellent hotel!
Great choice for Barcelona
reviews.text: The hotel should have been a very good hotel but for the work site situated right in front of it. We arrived the hotel after leaving the cruise ship early in the morning and arrived at the hotel some time after 9 a.m.. Despite my request to have a room at a higher floor, the girl at the front desk said I could only check into a room on the 3rd floor immediately, or I would have to wait until 12 noon, the regular check in/out time. for another room on the 8th floor. There was also a condition that I would not be able to change my room once I had checked into the 3rd floor room. Since I have only 2 days in Barcelona, I wanted to settle down as soon as possible so that I could start my sightseeing earlier, I decided to accept the 3rd floor room and was fully prepared to take this as a room without a view. However, we had overlooked one thing or had we been alerted at all, i.e. it faced the worksite in front of the hotel. At 4 o’clock in the morning, workmen started talking loudly outside the worksite and heavy machines were clanking up and it was just impossible to continue with our sleep. We did not negotiate with the hotel for a change of room because we would have to get up at 3 a.m. to catch a flight home on the second morning. I wonder whether the hotel will allow us to change our room even if we asked.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another problem is the partition between the bathroom and the living area. Part of the partition is made of translucent glass. When I had to use the bathroom during the night, light came out through the glass partition and shone directly on the face of my wife and this woke her up. I cannot understand the rational of using the glass partition nor its location. If the designer wanted something translucent to create an ambient or what not, he should, say, use a translucent glass door, which faced the closet.
reviews.title: Pleasant Hotel Superb location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not having been to Barcelona in several years, I managed to get a cheap flight and boked this hotel very cheaply on the internet. Having paid through the nose in the past and stayed in some scary locations, I was somewhat apprehensive about returning to Barcelona. My wife however likes to shop and practice her spanish, and I would go anywhere rather than work! Enough drivel. The hotel is beside Saints train station. The train was free to and from the airport (only costs E2.50 anyway). The hotel has a metro nearby. Staff are very efficient. The hotel is of a good standard and worth travelling out of the centre of the town to. We found a good cafe/bar opposite the metro, which was really cheap, but really good, much better than stuffy hotel breakfasts. The bar has a wide range of drinks, but gave us cava rather than champaigne, yet charged the full price. On our second night there the station was having renovation work done. Builders worked throughout the night, VERY NOiSLY. Thank god I was'nt staying longer. I would definately go back once the building work was complete. Whilst it wasen't the hotels fault it is impossible to sleep through. Surely the locals can put a stop to this. Give it a month or two and it should be fine.
reviews.title: Safe Hotel in easy to get to location

likes.disliked: — Beally noisy due to all night building work at nearby station (Temporary problem)
